p: Pendular migration data have been increasingly used to describe population mobility in epidemic models [ 21â€“ 28]. The present study showed that the pendular migration is significantly associated with the chance of occurrence of influenza, such that municipalities with greater flow of people have a greater chance of occurrence of the disease. Charaudeau et al. [ 29], using data from epidemics of influenza-like illness in France, also showed that pendular migration is highly correlated with the spread of disease.
